sourcing.instructions: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers; Co (Cobalt powder) - Metal supply stores or online marketplaces; Ga (Gallium) - Metal suppliers; Tb (Terbium oxide) - Rare earth suppliers; Y (Yttrium oxide) - Chemical supply stores.
steps: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers; Co (Cobalt powder) - Metal supply stores or online marketplaces; Ga (Gallium) - Metal suppliers; Tb (Terbium oxide) - Rare earth suppliers; Y (Yttrium oxide) - Chemical supply stores.

1. Weigh out each material using an accurate balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine 120 g of B, 270 g of Co, 60 g of Ga, 50 g of Tb, and 10 g of Y. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders until a homogeneous mixture is achieved.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out each material using an accurate balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine 120 g of B, 270 g of Co, 60 g of Ga, 50 g of Tb, and 10 g of Y. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders until a homogeneous mixture is achieved.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a high-temperature crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace and set the temperature to 1200°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and solidification.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a high-temperature crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace and set the temperature to 1200°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and solidification.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature over approximately 6 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled completely to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature over approximately 6 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled completely to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use sandpaper (grit 120, followed by 400) to smooth the surface of the sample. 3. If required, apply a sealing coat or protective layer to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use sandpaper (grit 120, followed by 400) to smooth the surface of the sample. 3. If required, apply a sealing coat or protective layer to enhance durability.
